JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE , respectively . They live in GPE . They are represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE the applicants arrived in GPE . Shortly thereafter they applied for asylum .

On DATE the first applicant married an NORP national . On DATE she applied for a residence permit on the basis of her marriage . She did not therefore pursue the asylum application . The marriage subsequently failed and the first applicant separated from her husband . Accordingly , on DATE ORG , LAW reform revoked her leave to remain as she was no longer residing with her spouse and proposed to deport her . The Minister for ORG and Law Reform ( “ the Minister ” ) issued a deportation order in DATE .

On DATE the applicants re - applied for asylum . The first applicant was interviewed on DATE . The application for asylum was based on the following claims . The first applicant claimed that she was ill in her late teens and was sent to live with the family of a native doctor ( “ E ” ) in or DATE . Thereafter , she was effectively detained by that family . E cut her with a blade and rubbed charcoal into her wounds and DATE began raping her . E threatened to kill the first applicant ’s father when the latter protested . Her father later died in DATE . She gave birth to her son in DATE and to the second applicant in DATE . In DATE E died . Since E ’s brother wished to marry the first applicant , the applicants escaped from E ’s funeral . They fled to GPE . Following threats , they left for GPE and , subsequently , they left for GPE , via GPE , leaving the first applicant ’s son with her mother . The first applicant claims that she was subjected to LAW ( “ ORG ” ) against her will prior to the birth of the second applicant . She feared that , on return , that she would be kidnapped and re - detained by E ’s family and that the second applicant would be subjected to ORG . The first applicant claims that internal re - location is not an option and that the NORP police would not assist her .

By letter of DATE the applicants were informed that ORG Commissioner ( “ ORG ” ) was recommending that they not be declared refugees . The PERSON report highlighted , inter alia , certain inconsistencies and vagueness in her claims and her failure to seek protection from the NORP police .

By decision of DATE , notified to the applicant on CARDINAL DATE , ORG ( “ RAT ” ) affirmed the recommendation of the ORG . The RAT , inter alia , found parts of her claim to be inconsistent and vague , relied on the country - of - origin information about ORG in GPE and noted her failure to seek assistance of the NORP authorities or asylum in GPE . The applicants were legally represented before the RAT .

In DATE the applicants applied , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW CARDINAL , for leave to apply for judicial review citing the RAT , the Minister , GPE and the Attorney General as respondents . They requested , inter alia , an order quashing the decision of the RAT as well as declarations that the RAT ’s failure to publish its previous decisions was unconstitutional and that the second applicant should have been heard as she was no longer an infant . They also took issue in some detail with the RAT ’s assessment of their factual claims .
On DATE the respondents filed a replying affidavit . In DATE the case was listed for hearing in DATE .
On DATE the High Court heard the applicants’ judicial review application and judgment was reserved .
In DATE the case was listed for mention when the parties were informed that judgment was not available . The applicants inquired on several later occasions about the delivery of the judgment .

The matter was listed for mention on CARDINAL DATE and the parties were informed that a judgment was not available . ORG requested the parties to explore a settlement of the action . Accordingly , on DATE the applicants wrote to the respondents seeking a possible settlement . No response was received .
The case was again listed for mention on DATE and ORG informed the parties that a judgment was not available but that a judgment should be ready by DATE .
By notice dated DATE , the applicants notified ORG of their change of solicitor .
The case has not been re - listed since then and no judgment has been delivered to date .
